text: Watershed map showing Marsh Creek Marsh Creek is a U.S. Geological Survey. National Hydrography Dataset high-resolution flowline data. The National Map , accessed August 15, 2011 tributary of the Monocacy River in south-central Pennsylvania and north-central Maryland in the United States.Gertler, Edward. Keystone Canoeing, Seneca Press, 2004. Marsh Creek and Rock Creek join below Gettysburg and the Gettysburg Battlefield to form the Monocacy River. The height of land between Marsh and Rock creeks is the site of the Battle of Gettysburg. ==See also== *List of rivers of Maryland *List of rivers of Pennsylvania ==References== ==External links== *U.S. Geological Survey: PA stream gaging stations Category:Rivers of Maryland Category:Rivers of Pennsylvania Category:Rivers of Frederick County, Maryland Category:Rivers of Adams County, Pennsylvania Category:Tributaries of the Monocacy River
title: Marsh Creek (Monocacy River tributary)
